free_text.Learning outcomes: [li] To make researchers aware of good scientific writing.[br/][li] To help writers structure their articles.[br/][li] To point out the pitfalls in scientific articles.[br/][li] To enable researchers to face their writing tasks with confidence
free_text.Content: [li] Comparing a scientific article written in different styles.[br/][li] Participants will write the Title, Abstract and Introduction to their article which will be discussed in class.[br/][li] Readability exercises (turning clumsy, wordy writing into clear understandable writing).[br/][li] Editing a badly written text.[br/][li] How to make a good poster.[br/][li] Any subject of participants' choice to be decide in class.
free_text.Note: This is an interactive course so PhD students should be in their 2nd or 3rd year and in the process of writing an article. This is a 4 day course of 4 hours each and on the last day each student will have an individual[br/]session of 30 minutes where she/he can bring any part of the article.
